questions.query: Which of the following alternatives describes the RLG best?

options.text: Two light beams are made to rotate at a very high speed. The two light beams are brought together. The phase difference between the two lightbeams is a measure for the angular rate.
A LASER beam is made to travel round at the speed of light this causes a gyroscope with a high stability.
Two LASER beams travel in opposite direction. While being rotated, the time difference between arrival of the two beams is measured.
Two LASER beams travel round in opposite direction. The two beams are made to interfere with each other. As a result an interferention or fringe pattern occurs that can be measured.

questions.query: Is the flux valve (FV) sensitive to the aircraft magnetic field?

options.text: No, since the FV is mounted far away from the fuselage.
No, since the FV is mounted in a metal enclosure filled with a damping fluid.
No, provided a yearly compass swing is carried out.
Yes, but because of the electro-magnetic compensation the error is neglible.
options.comment: Correct.

questions.query: Does the flux valve of a gyromagnetic compass suffer from the influence of the aircraft magnetic field?

options.text: No, since the flux valve is an electro-magnetic field sensor instead of a magnetic field sensor.
No, because of the adjustable permanent NS and EW compensating magnets near the flux valve.
Yes, but less than a stand alone Directional Gyro.
Yes, but the gyromagnetic compass is normally fully compensated for.

questions.query: The purpose of the flux valve is...

options.text: to improve the accuracy of the Direct Reading Magnetic Compass (DRMC).
to measure the strength and direction of the aircraft magnetic field.
to counteract (compensate) the influence of the aircraft magnetic field.
to measure the horizontal component of the earth's magnetic field.
options.comment: Manually set as correct, might be different from source.

questions.query: The most effective action one can take to increase the rigidity of a gyroscope is to double...

options.comment:
H = I x wg where I = m x r2.

Increasing rpm helps, but increasing radius is more effective.

questions.query: Any movement of the gyro away from its original position is called wander. Depending on the direction of movement of the spin axis the gyro is said to be drifting or toppling. Drift is defined as:

options.text: Wander in the horizontal and in the vertical plane.

options.text: Now the precession is such that the input axis maintains more or less aligned with the local vertical.

options.text: Now the gyro also becomes sensitive for a rotation around the longitudinal axis.
Now the gyro precesses in the direction of the turn.
Now the gyro is more rigid in space.

too much pitch and too little roll

options.text: a Directional Gyro (DG) controlled by a flux valve

questions.query: The Remote Reading Magnetic Compass (RRMC) consists of a remote...
What is the correct alignment sequence of an inertial navigation system?

options.text: 1: Coarse level, 2: Fine level, 3: Coarse azimuth, 4: Gyrocompassing.
1: Coarse level, 2: Coarse azimuth, 3: Fine level, 4: Gyrocompassing.
options.comment: Manually set as correct, might be different from source.

options.text: 1: Coarse azimuth, 2: Coarse level, 3: Fine alignment, 4: Gyrocompassing.
1: Coarse azimuth, 2: Fine alignment, 3: Coarse level, 4: Gyrocompassing.

questions.query:
See the figure below.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

An aircraft, equipped with INS, has passed waypoint 'X' and is tracking along the line TK (dashed).

With DA/HDG is selected on the control and display unit (CDU), the display shows 6L / 080.

 

When DSRTK/STS is selected on the CDU, the left window will show:

options.comment:
HDG = 080;

DA = 6L;

TK = 074;

DSTK is six degrees left of TK.

DSTK = 068.

questions.query: A ring laser gyro, triangular layout, employs:

options.text: 2 lasers, 2 fully silvered mirrors and a partially silvered mirror
1 laser, 1 fully silvered mirror and 2 partially silvered mirrors

questions.query: The task of the inner loop of an auto pilot channel is to control:

options.text: the autopilot computer is fed back with information regarding the actual (measured) value of the controlled parameter
the maintenance computer registrates the performance of the autopilot. This information can be read via datalink or when back on the ground
the human pilot continously monitors the behavior of the automatic pilot
ATC checks the behavior of the automatic pilot for instance in case of a level bust

options.text: To show how much a flight control must be deflected.

questions.query: Which statement concerning the YD actuator is correct?

options.text: The YD actuator connects to the rudder.

The YD actuator connects to the ailerons.

options.text: The YD can only operate when the AP is engaged.

options.text: The YD can only operate when the AP is disengaged.

questions.query:
The Flight Envelope Protection (FEP) system has the following functions...

  1. Stall protection;
  2. Overspeed protection;
  3. Excessive rate of descent protection;
  4. Altitude alerting;
  5. Dutch roll damping.

options.comment: Correct.

questions.query:
Which statement about the Automatic Throttle System (ATS) is true?

 

  1. The ATS engages when, after arming the ATS, the TO/GA switches on the throttle levers are operated.
  2. The ATS disengages when one of the switches on the throttle knobs is operated.

options.comment: Manually set as correct, might be different from source.

questions.query: In FADEC equipped aeroplanes the Automatic Throttle System (ATS) may control thrust without moving the thrust levers:

options.text: the position of the thrust levers determine the maximum thrust.
the thrust lever movement does not affect the thrust.
the thrust levers stay in the idle position.
as soon as the thrust levers are moved the system reverts from autothrust to manual thrust.

questions.query: Which statement is true when comparing voice communication with data communication in aviation?

options.text: Voice communication is VHF; data communication is UHF.
Modern communication is through digital data; voice is used as a back-up.
Data communication leads to less misunderstanding and is less time consuming.
options.comment: Correct.

options.text: Voice communication is via sound waves; data communication is via radio waves.

one title field line, two columns of each four selectable lines and two selectable scratchpad lines.

options.text: The stickshaker 'shakes' the control column during an impending stall.
